connector.description: Read and write nodes to/from a JCR compliant content repository.

camel.sink.path.host.name: camel.sink.path.host
camel.sink.path.host.description: Name of the javax.jcr.Repository to lookup from the Camel registry to be used.

camel.sink.path.base.name: camel.sink.path.base
camel.sink.path.base.description: Get the base node when accessing the repository

camel.sink.endpoint.deep.name: camel.sink.endpoint.deep
camel.sink.endpoint.deep.description: When isDeep is true, events whose associated parent node is at absPath or within its subgraph are received.

camel.sink.endpoint.eventTypes.name: camel.sink.endpoint.eventTypes
camel.sink.endpoint.eventTypes.description: eventTypes (a combination of one or more event types encoded as a bit mask value such as javax.jcr.observation.Event.NODE_ADDED, javax.jcr.observation.Event.NODE_REMOVED, etc.).

camel.sink.endpoint.nodeTypeNames.name: camel.sink.endpoint.nodeTypeNames
camel.sink.endpoint.nodeTypeNames.description: When a comma separated nodeTypeName list string is set, only events whose associated parent node has one of the node types (or a subtype of one of the node types) in this list will be received.

camel.sink.endpoint.noLocal.name: camel.sink.endpoint.noLocal
camel.sink.endpoint.noLocal.description: If noLocal is true, then events generated by the session through which the listener was registered are ignored. Otherwise, they are not ignored.

camel.sink.endpoint.sessionLiveCheckInte.name: camel.sink.endpoint.sessionLiveCheckInterval
camel.sink.endpoint.sessionLiveCheckInte.description: Interval in milliseconds to wait before each session live checking The default value is 60000 ms.

camel.sink.endpoint.sessionLiveCheckInte.name: camel.sink.endpoint.sessionLiveCheckIntervalOnStart
camel.sink.endpoint.sessionLiveCheckInte.description: Interval in milliseconds to wait before the first session live checking. The default value is 3000 ms.

camel.sink.endpoint.uuids.name: camel.sink.endpoint.uuids
camel.sink.endpoint.uuids.description: When a comma separated uuid list string is set, only events whose associated parent node has one of the identifiers in the comma separated uuid list will be received.

camel.sink.endpoint.workspaceName.name: camel.sink.endpoint.workspaceName
camel.sink.endpoint.workspaceName.description: The workspace to access. If it's not specified then the default one will be used

camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.name: camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer
camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.component.jcr.lazyStartProducer.name: camel.component.jcr.lazyStartProducer
camel.component.jcr.lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.component.jcr.autowiredEnabled.name: camel.component.jcr.autowiredEnabled
camel.component.jcr.autowiredEnabled.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.
